text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the answer to mention that the right to object to false attribution (s. 84 CDPA) is a separate Moral Right from Paternity or Integrity. The candidate answer explicitly discusses Moral Rights under Chapter IV of the CDPA 1988, mentioning Section 77 (Paternity/Identification), Section 80 (Derogatory Treatment/Integrity), and Section 84 (False Attribution). It states: \"Section 84: The right not to have a work falsely attributed to you. While the advert credited the user rather than you, if anyone is led to believe the character originated from someone other than you, there may be an argument here too.\" This directly addresses and mentions Section 84, placing it within the context of the other moral rights (Paternity/Integrity), thereby satisfying the requirement of the rubric criterion.", "criterion_id": "d99a3d6d-08d1-4252-a00d-6e09a19c60fa"}
